message_1: What is the smallest number x such that 3^x ≡ 13 (mod 19)?
message_2:
To find the smallest number x such that 3^x ≡ 13 (mod 19), we can use the method of successive squaring and modular exponentiation. We will compute the powers of 3 modulo 19 until we find one that is congruent to 13.

1. 3^1 ≡ 3 (mod 19)
2. 3^2 ≡ 9 (mod 19)
3. 3^3 ≡ 27 ≡ 8 (mod 19)
4. 3^4 ≡ 81 ≡ 5 (mod 19)
5. 3^5 ≡ 243 ≡ 13 (mod 19)

We found that 3^5 ≡ 13 (mod 19). Therefore, the smallest number x is 5.
